He would like to grow the business further and so he has applied for a loan to purchase an apricot orchard. His work season is now, since apricots have already ripened. He is requesting a loan of 5,000 somoni. He awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy an apricot orchard for his business

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean is 35 years old and married with three children.

Jean works hard to provide for her family; she runs a rice retailing business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase sacks of rice to sell.

Jean has borrowed and paid back four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the rice retailing business for two years and also earns an income from farming rice.

Jean aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Mildred works hard to support her family. She has a food production business in the Philippines and also earns additional income through pig fattening. 

Mildred is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food business. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans through NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline lives in the Litein area of Kenya. She has 4 children and has been doing this work (farming) for 6 years. Her primary income sources come from selling milk, eggs, and tea.

She stated that in farming, her biggest challenge is that, "Animal feeds are expensive." Animals on the farm have been given the names of 'Moita'.

Caroline was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied, "Because of good training."  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session. She said, "It gives loans to farmers."

Her highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked how this loan would benefit her family, Caroline replied that it, "Will help meet family needs." The loan will be used to construct a grazing unit.

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Caroline owns the following: cows and poultry, but does not own, "pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, automobile." Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household mosquito nets, but does not have, "electricity, solar power, running water, sewing machine, TV, DVD."

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: to construct a grazing unit

loans.name: Benkadi 5 Group

texts.fr:
Les  5  membres du groupe  Benkadi 5 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 31 ans, 4 enfants et vivant tous dans des  familles traditionnelles à Faraba, un des quartiers de la ville Bougouni, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur septième  prêt avec l’institution et les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est le riz et l’arachide, avec  Korotoumou 1ere assise de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo, elle compte acheter avec son prêt, des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du marché,  après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 35.000 francs CFA en fin de campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de subvenir à ses besoins et aussi aider la famille dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The five members of the Benkadi 5 group are married women, on the average 31 years of age, with four children. They all live in traditional families in Faraba, a district in the town of Bougouni, the third administrative region of Mali.
They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to better ménage their agricultural activities during the rainy season. They are on their seventh loan, and their prior loan have been duly repaid.
They cultivate rice and peanuts, which is what Korotomou does, for example. She is first one seated from the right in the photo. She plans to use her loan to buy agricultural inputs [fertilizers, etc] and seeds and pay the cost of labor to work 1 ha [2.5 acres] of land. After harvesting, she sells her produce at the marketplace, to a customer base composed of both men and women.
She plans to earn 35,000 West African francs at the end of the agricultural season. This revenue will allow her to provide for her own needs as well as help out her family with everyday expenses.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs and seeds and pay the cost of labor.

loans.name: Therese

texts.en: Therese is 59 years old. She is the mother of eight children; some of them attend school. With the loan, Therese would like to buy more motorcycle spare parts for selling. The profits from the business will be used to create savings.

loans.use: to buy more motorcycle spare parts for selling

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites works hard to support her family. She is a single woman and has a business selling used clothing in the Philippines.

Marites requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks of used clothes to sell. She has been in this business for ten years.

In the future, Marites would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of used clothes for selling

loans.name: Rayma

texts.en:
Rayma is 45 years old with five children. With two children currently in school, Rayma works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell in her general store.

Rayma has been in this business for 2 years and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, laundry soap, milk, sugar, eggs, noodles, etc.

Rayma would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Racel

texts.en: Racel of Clarin, Misamis Occidental is a married woman with two children and is 38. She owns and manages a store providing goods in the local community. She has been doing this for a year. Recently, she request an amount of 3,000.00 PHP from GDMPC micro credit to purchase additional working capital like canned goods and noodles. She plans to use the profits in addition to her capital to generate double income in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase additional working inventory capital like canned goods and noodles

loans.name: Vidal

texts.es: Vidal de 42 años de edad, es reconocido en su localidad, por el gran servicio que presta. Su salón de belleza es sin duda uno de los más populares gracias a su trabajo. Con más de 15 años de experiencia, este hombre ha sabido ganarse el cariño de su localidad. Cuenta que aprendió el oficio gracias a su madre y varias capacitaciones que realizó. Hoy desea mejorar la calidad en el servicio, por lo cual se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de un computador con el fin de que los clientes lo usen mientras esperan el turno. De esta manera dará un valor agregado a su negocio y aumentará el número de usuarios e ingresos monetarios.
texts.en: Vidal is 42 years old. He is known in his community for the great service he provides. His beauty salon is without a doubt one of the most popular thanks to his work. With more than 15 years experience, this man has been able to earn the affection of his community. He says that he learned the trade thanks to his mother and various trainings that he has done. Today he wants to improve the quality of his service and so he is asking for a loan that he will invest in buying a computer so that his customers can use it while they are waiting their turn. This way, he will have value added to his business and increase the number of users and income.

loans.use: to buy a computer

loans.name: Malik

texts.ru:
Малик занимается откормом и купле продажей скота. Он мужчина среднего возраста. Родился в Исфаре, в дальнем кишлаке. Женат и имеет троих детей. Жена работает в местном колхозе. Старший сын находится в Российской Федерации на заработках. А младший еще ходит в школу, но всегда помогает родителям в хозяйственных делах дома. Малик сотрудничает с Арванд более трех лет. Когда впервые он обратился в организацию Арванд , у него всего лишь была одна корова. И после получения кредита он купил еще одну корову и быка и 10 голов мелко рогатого скота. Благодаря Арванду он намного расширил свой бизнес и улучшил свои условия проживания.
 Сейчас Малик хочет купить телят и до зимы откормив их продать по выгодной цене. Поэтому Малик в очередной раз обратился в организацию Арванд так как не имеет достаточно денежных средств на руках. Малик очень надеется на очередную помощь от Арванд и заранее благодарит за поддержку.
texts.en:
Malik buys, raises and resells cattle. He is a middle-aged man. He was born in a village in Isfara. He is married and has three children. His wife works at a local farm. His oldest son is working abroad in Russia. His youngest is still in school, but always helps his parents with household work. 

Malik has been working with Arvand for over three years. When he first approached the Arvand organization, he only had one cow. After receiving a loan, he purchased another cow, a bull, and 10 sheep and goats. Thanks to Arvand, he significantly grew his business and improved his living conditions.

Now, Malik wants to purchase calves, raise them until winter, and sell them for a profit. Since he does not have sufficient cash on hand, Malik once again approached Arvand. Malik has high hopes for recurring help from Arvand and offers thanks in advance for their support.

loans.use: to purchase calves

loans.name: Ha

texts.en:
Ha was born in 1981. She has two children who are studying in 5th and 3rd grade. To earn a living, her husband is a guard. He earns about 4,000,000 VND per month.

Ha owns an internet room. Her income is about 5,000,000 VND per month. She has done this job for 3 years. Besides that, she is also a farmer to earn more money. Her challenge in work is lack of capital. Her dream is to be able to enlarge her business and for her children to grow up well. This loan is one step toward helping her reaching her dream.

Ha has participated in SEDA’s credit program since 2007. In the last loan cycle, she borrowed 5,014,000 VND. In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 6,322,000 VND to buy more tables and chairs for her internet shop, so that her children can grow up well.

loans.use: to buy more tables and chairs for her internet shop

loans.name: Yamid Elena

texts.es:
Yamid de 41 años de edad, es madre de dos hijos de 16 y 4 años. Para sacarlos adelante ha tenido que hacer grandes sacrificios, pero asegura que por sus hijos daría la vida si fuera necesario.
Ha laborado en varios almacenes de su localidad, por lo cual aprendió del oficio y adquirió la experiencia que la motivó a crear su negocio, Desde hace algunos años se dedica a  la venta de ropa y accesorios desde su casa. Con el fin de seguir desarrollando la actividad y aumentar sus ingresos, se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de mercancía (ropa, calzado, accesorios).
Sueña en el mediano plazo montar un almacén con gran variedad y brindarle a su hijo mayor el acceso a la educación superior.
texts.en:
Yamid, 41 years old, is the mother of two children, ages 16 and four years. For them to move forward, she has had to make great sacrifices, but she assures us that for her children, she would give her life, if necessary.

She has worked in a variety of stores in her town, where she learned the trade and earned the experience that motivated her to start her business. For some years, she has sold clothes and accessories out of her home. With the goal of continuing to develop her business and increasing her revenues, she is requesting a loan that she will invest in the purchase of merchandise (clothes, shoes, accessories).

For the medium term, she dreams of opening her own store with a variety of merchandise and providing her son better access to higher education.

loans.use: purchase merchandise (clothes, shoes, accessories).

loans.name: Safarali

texts.ru: Сафарали является скотоводом. Ему 59 лет. Он живет и трудится в районе Хамадони. Сафарали отец троих сыновей и троих дочерей. Двое его старших сыновей работают мигрантами в России. Третий сын вместе с Сафарали занимается животноводством. Сафарали в течение 4-х лет занимается куплей и продажей крупнорогатого скота. Он разводит скот во дворе своего дома и после одного месяца откорма продает на местном рынке. Сафарали просит кредит для закупа бычков, чтобы увеличить поголовье продаваемого скота и продолжить деятельность. Он будет очень признателен за поддержку.
texts.en: Safarali raises livestock. He is 59 years old. He lives and works in the Hamadoni district. Safarali has three sons and three daughters. His two elder sons are migrant workers in Russia. The third son raises livestock alongside with Safarali. For four years, Safarali has been buying and reselling cattle. He fattens cattle in his backyard for a month and then sells it at the local market. Safarali is requesting a loan to buy young bulls in order to expand his headcount and develop his business. He really appreciates your support.

loans.use: to buy cattle for fattening and resale.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Regina is a single mother of two children and one of her children goes to school. She also takes care of additional family members (grandchildren). She has a tailoring business and has been in this business for 10 years. She has applied for a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more rolls of clothing materials, thread, and a new sewing machine. She works in the market seven days every week. She sells to all categories of people but on a retail basis only. Regina's major business challenges include defaulters, seasonality and thieves. She aspires to become a whole seller and also to build rental rooms. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, feeding the family and rent.

loans.use: To buy more rolls of clothing materials, thread, and a sewing machine.

loans.name: Apina

texts.en:
34-year-old Apina lives in the Gardabani district with her 41-year-old husband. Apina requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected every time, because of her low income and the family’s poor living conditions.

The only source of the income for the family is from trading clothes. They buy clothes at the wholesale price to resell them at a mark-up among the villagers and earn a small profit.
 
Apina requested a loan from Credo to start-up the family business. Apina has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions for rural poor people who do not have access to credit. These poor, rural people are regarded as “high-risk borrowers” because of their low income.

With her credit, Apina will purchase stock of clothes for her trading business. She wants to expand the varieties of the products she has to offer a better choice of products to her clients. As Apina will have a bigger stock she will significantly decrease the expanses and increase the profits. The family will use part of the profits for reinvesting and purchasing more clothes and part to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase stock of clothes for her trading business

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary is 50 years old and married with five children, two of whom are in school. Rosemary works very hard to provide for them.

Rosemary runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Rosemary has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap and other groceries. 

In the future, Rosemary would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Alphonsine

texts.en: Alphonsine is 23 years old. She has been selling foodstuffs for the past three years. With this loan, she would like to buy more sorghum, bananas and beans to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay for school fees for her three children.

loans.use: To buy more sorghum, bananas and beans to sell.

loans.name: Madres Coraje Group

texts.es: Este es el grupo “Madres Coraje” conformado por 05 socios, la gran mayoría de ellos vecinos de la zona que pasan a su 4to ciclo,  dicho grupo han demostrado  honestidad y solidaridad entre sus compañeros. María Teresa de 33 años de edad es separada con 01 hijo, la cual ha sido su motivo para salir adelante. María Teresa se inició en la venta de productos de belleza, con los deseos de superación María Teresa decide iniciar su nuevo negocio donde actualmente brinda materiales de construcción. Los ingresos que percibe lo destinan para alimentos y en la educación de su hijo. Con el crédito que solicitó comprará materiales de construcción  como clavos, fierros y brochas para pintar. Posteriormente piensa aperturar un restaurante, pues así asegura ella tendrá mayores ganancias. El grupo “Madres Coraje” agradecen el crédito brindado ya que hace posible su progreso. María Teresa es la segunda del lado derecho viste chompa negra y polo morado, la vemos acompañada de su hijo.
texts.en:
This is the "Madres Coraje (Courageous Mothers)" group, formed of five members. The large majority of them are neighbors in the area and going through their fourth loan cycle. This group has demonstrated honesty and solidarity among the members. Maria Teresa, 33 years old, is separated with one son, who has been her motivation for moving upward and onward. Maria Teresa started selling beauty products with the goal of moving up. Maria Teresa decided to start her new business where she now provides construction materials.

The revenues that she earns are used for groceries and for her son's education. With the loan that she requested, she will purchase construction materials such as nails, metals, and paintbrushes. Later, she is thinking of opening a restaurant, and she says she will have better earnings. The Madres Coraje group is grateful for the loan provided because it makes their progress possible. Maria Teresa is the second from the right (in the photo), seen wearing the black sweater and brown polo shirt. We see her accompanied by her son.

loans.use: purchase nails, metal, and paint brushes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase basic materials such as corn, firewood, and plastic bags.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a 51-year-old married woman blessed with four children. She sells maize for a living, a business she has been in for six years now, earning a monthly income of 5,000 KES. 

She has requested a third loan of 20,000 KES to purchase more bags of maize to sell. The anticipated profits will aid her in paying school fees for her children.

Joyce dreams of having a well-established business.

loans.use: To purchase bags of maize to sell.

loans.name: Venus - 32 Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento VENUS – 32 está  compuesto por diez  integrantes ocho   mujeres y dos varones, este banco ya tiene un crédito con la institución, cambiaron algunas socias ya que hubo algunos problema entre ellas, solo quedaron las personas responsables, la presidenta del banco sigue siendo la Sra. Abigail tiene 23 años y tiene un hijito de la edad de 3años, La Sra. Abigail tiene la actividad de venta de accesorios para movilidad desde hace ya bastante tiempo tiene su tienda de accesorios que se encuentra en la zona Siles en este lugar es muy concurrido por choferes que realizan el mantenimiento de sus vehículos, este préstamo es su segunda secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Abigail va a usar este préstamo para la compra de accesorios y repuestos para surtir su tienda   y así de esta manera brindar un mejor servicio a  sus clientes e incrementar sus ganancias,  cuenta que le fue bien con el anterior crédito que lo utilizo también en la compra de accesorios ya que siempre quiere surtir su tienda de variedad de productos su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio, la Sra. Abigail va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando accesorio  la Sra. Abigail  es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada a ella ya sus compañeras de grupo ya que en algunos casos mantienen solas a sus familias.
texts.en:
Venus-32 Communal Bank is made up of ten members, eight women and two men.  This bank already has a loan with the institution.  Some members have changed because there were some problems; only the responsible people stayed.

Abigail, 23, is still the president of the bank.  She has a little boy who's three years old.  Abigail's job for some time has been selling vehicle accessories.  Her store's located in the Siles area, which is busy with drivers who are doing maintenance on their vehicles.

This is her second loan sequence with the institution.  Abigail's going to use this loan to buy accessories and parts to stock her store.  This way she'll offer better customer service and increase her profits.

She says it went well for her with the previous loan, which she also used to buy accessories because she always wants to stock her store with a variety of products.  She's requesting this loan to continue improving her business.  Abigail's going to use the profits to continue buying accessories.

Abigail's a very hardworking person.  She's happy about the opportunity for herself and her group members because in some cases they support their families alone.

loans.use: to buy vehicle accessories

loans.name: Ritah

texts.en: Ritah is a hard-working woman with two children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. Her main business is running a bar and farming. She faces hardships of high rent costs and price fluctuation, while her dreams are to operate a hotel, educate her children so they attain degrees as minimum qualifications, and venture into motorcycle transport. Ritah intends to use the loan to buy a motorcycle for her transport business.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for her transport business.

loans.name: Juan Crisostomo

texts.es: El socio Juan nació en la ciudad de Chimur pero vive en la comunidad de Pilco – Grande, él tiene 58 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene siete hijos, él se dedica a la agricultura y tiene varios terrenos de cultivos  donde siembra papa, maíz, lizas, manzanas y a la crianza de animales menores como por ejemplo cuyes, gallinas, chanchos y etc. Él requiere el préstamo para comprar semillas y fertilizantes. Él está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de sus cuotas. (La comunidad de Pilco – Grande está ubicado en el distrito de Huayllabamba dentro de la provincia de Paucartambo en el  departamento de Cusco, Perú).
texts.en: The borrower Juan was born in the city of Chimur, but he lives in the community of Pilco - Grande. He is 58 years old and has a wife, with whom he has seven children. He farms and has several farmlands where he plants potatoes, corn, and apples, and raises small animals such as guinea pigs, chickens, pigs, etc. He needs a loan to purchase seeds and fertilizers. He is happy because of this loan and promises to make his payments. (The community of Pilco - Grande is located in the district of Huayllabamba in the province of Paucartambo in the department of Cusco, Peru.)

loans.use: purchase seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Bellanira

texts.es:
Bellanira es de San Ignacio, tiene 18 años, es una joven con muchas ansias de estudiar, salir adelante y el día de mañana ser una gran profesional. Su sueno es poder ayudar a su familia por medio de si trabajo y profesión. Ella esta estudiando Administración bancaria y cuenta que en el año 2016 estaría terminando su carrera.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en pagar cuotas en la universidad, ya que de esa forma podrá ayudar a su familia y aligerar un poco la carga. Agradece esta oportunidad que está recibiendo ya que le será de gran ayuda.
texts.en:
Bellanira es from San Ignacio and is 18 years old. She is a young person who wishes to study, move forward, and be a great professional tomorrow. Her dream is to be able to help her family through her work and profession. She is studying banking administration and in 2016 will finish her studies. 

She is requesting this loan to be able to invest in paying the university fees, and in this way she will be able to help her family and be able to lighten the load. She is thankful for this opportunity that she is receiving since it will be a big help.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: El Progreso Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado el Progreso está en su ciclo número 12 del programa de comité de mujeres, las integrantes están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, ya que de esa forma podrán saber la situación de cada una de ellas.
Isabel, una de las integrantes se encuentra en un nivel medio de ingresos, trabaja día a día tenazmente y así está trabajando de mejorar sus ingresos. Cuenta que tiene una despensa bien surtida con todo tipo de productos de primera necesidad, con el que surte y da a sus clientes todo lo que necesitan. Su meta es poder ir agrandando su negocio para poder ofrecer mejora variedad a sus clientes y también mayor comodidad.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de bebidas, carnes, yerba, arroz, huevos y demás insumos para poder surtir su negocio y dar a sus clientes todo lo que necesitan. Ella agradece por la oportunidad que sus compañeras y ella están recibiendo.
texts.en:
The Progreso group is in its 12th cycle of the program of the women's committee. The members are doing a survey about the elimination of poverty, since in this way they will be able to know the situation of every one of them. 

Isabel, one of the members, is at a medium level of income. She works day to day tenaciously and is working to increase her income. She has a well-stocked grocery store with all types of products of top necessity, and she stocks it with everything that her customers need. Her goal is to be able to expand her business in order to be able to offer better variety to her customers and also more convenience. 

She is requesting this loan for the purchase of sodas, meats, herbs, rice, eggs, and further supplies in order to be able to stock her business and give her customers all that they need. She is thankful for the opportunity that she and her fellow members are receiving.

loans.use: to purchase sodas, meat, herbs, rice, eggs, and further supplies.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es: Ana María tiene 48 años de edad es una señora casada con el señor Manuel con quien ha formado una familia con cuatro hijos que aun dependen de dicha pareja. La señora Mary se dedica a la venta de tacos desde hace 16 años, ella cuenta que inicio porque un familiar de su esposo tenía un restaurante-bar pero tiempo después dejo su negocio fue así como el esposo de Doña Mary retomo el negocio  la venta de los tacos. Doña Mary como de cariño le dicen platica que gracias al crédito pudo comprar ocho marranitos para la cría y engorda  pero también compro bultos de alimento para sus cerdo la señora mari esta muy agradecida con  el préstamo porque ya tiene sus cerditos.  La dificultad que atraviesa Doña Mari es la falta de dinero para comprar en cantidades grandes el alimento para sus cerditos porque comenta “Si el alimento estuviera mas barato yo tendría los mismos cerditos que con anterioridad tenia” La señora Mari llego a tener 60 cerditos solo para engorda pero el precio el alimento se ha elevado mucho y cree no poder mantenerlos a todos.  Los cerditos que compro los crecerá y engordara solo en cuatro meses después de este tiempo piensa venderlos en sus puestos de comida corrida como tacos de carnitas, La señora Mari tiene tres puestos de tacos en el municipio. Doña Mary comento "Solo que con esta situación sueño con tener mi propio negocio en mi casa donde ya no vivamos angustiados" ya que los lugares donde tiene sus puestos ambulantes no son propios vive angustiada porque algún día se los quitaran.
texts.en:
Ana Maria is 48 years old and is married to Manuel, with whom she has grown a family of four children who still depend on the couple. Mary has sold tacos for 16 years. She says that she started because a family member of her husband's has a restaurant-bar, but after time left the business, so Mary's husband took over the business of selling the tacos. Mary, such a sweetie, says thanks to the loan, she was able to buy eight pigs to raise and fatten, but she also bought bags of food for her pigs. Mary is very grateful for the loan because she already has her piglets.

The difficulty that Mary is facing is that she does not have the money to purchase large quantities of food for her little pigs because she says, "If the food were cheaper, I would have the same pigs that I had before." Mary came to have 60 piglets just for fattening, but the price of the food has gone up by a lot, and she believes she won't be able to care for all of them. The piglets that she bought will grow and get fat in just four months, and after this time, she thinks she will sell them in her fast food stalls as meat tacos. Mary has three taco stands in the town. Mary said that "Only in this situation, I dream of having my own business in my home where we won't live with such worry," because the places where she has her stands are not her own, and she lives worried because some day they will be taken from her.

loans.use: purchase new little pigs and bags of food for her piglets.

loans.name: Ofelya

texts.en:
Ofelya and her husband, who is retired now, own a small farm and a plot of private land for their family needs. They cultivate apples, nuts, plums and also some vegetables; potatoes, cucumbers and tomatoes. Their farm is not very rich, but they manage to have a small income from selling its products to their loyal customers right from their house. In their farm they keep two cows, three bee colonies, and fifteen chickens. They sell milk, cheese, meat, eggs and honey.

Ofelya lives in Khachatryan village in Tavush area. Ofelya is a really hard-working woman, since she combines her work with their farming activities. She works as a leading specialist in her village agriculture. For many years Ofelya and her husband lived and worked in Azerbaijan, but 25 years ago they came back to their homeland because it was a really peaceful and native land where they could live and have children. They have two daughters who are married and live with their families.

Ofelya asks a loan of 500,000 Armenian drams to buy three bee colonies, two piglets, some chickens, and animal fodder. It is Ofelya’s first loan from Kiva but she has taken from Nor Horizon already twice and successfully paid it back.

loans.use: to buy three bee colonies, two piglets, some chickens, and animal fodder.

loans.name: Momarandu Group

texts.es:
En su quinto ciclo del programa de mujeres emprendedoras se encuentra este grupo llamado Momarandu. Este grupo es de la ciudad de Encarnación, y las integrantes están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, el cual les ayudará a conocer la situación económica de cada una.
Rosa es una de las integrantes del grupo, ella por medio de la venta de prendas y gracias a su esfuerzo y sacrificio ha ido formándose una buena clientela que de a poco está creciendo y con lo cual está ganándose la vida. Ella quiere que el dia de mañana su negocio vaya creciendo más y siga ayudando a quienes necesitan también.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de jeans, remeras, camisas, pantalones y demás, para poder seguir con sus ventas y teniendo los ingresos para trabajar. Agradece por la oportunidad que ella y sus amigas están recibiendo, ya que les será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
The Momarandu group is in its 5th cycle of the program of entrepreneurial women. This group is from the city of Encarnación, and the members are doing a survey of the elimination of poverty, which will help them know the economic situation of every member. 

Rosa is a member of the group. Through clothing sales and thanks to her efforts and sacrifice, she has built a good customer base, which is growing, and with which she is making a living. She wants her business to keep growing more and also to be able to help those who need it. 

She is requesting this loan for the purchase of jeans, t-shirts, shirts, pants, and more, to be able to continue with her sales and have the income to work. She is thankful for that opportunity that she and her friends are receiving, since it will be much help.

loans.use: to purchase jeans, t-shirts, shirts, pants, and more to sell.

loans.name: Mujeres Pedrozeñas Group

texts.es:
Las 18 integrantes de este comité cuentan con actividades variadas, cada una de ellas trabajan por salir adelante y dar a sus familias todo lo que necesitan y que no tengan que pasar por ningún tipo de privaciones como las que ellas tuvieron que pasar.
Una de ellas es la Sra. Cynthia, quien se dedica a la venta de joyas y ropas variadas, es una persona muy honesta y trabajadora, que lucha por crecer y dar a su familia lo que necesitan. Ella cuenta que al principio le fue muy difícil empezar su negocio, pero que gracias a que se esforzó pudo ir mejorando su vida.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de prendas y joyas para que de esa forma pueda seguir con sus ventas y teniendo los ingresos para ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
The 18 members of this committee rely on various activities. Each one of them works to get ahead and give their families everything they need, so they don't have to go through any kind of hardship, as these women had to.

One of them, Cynthia, makes her living selling jewelry and various clothes. She is a very honest and hard-working person, who fights to grow and give her family what they need. She said that at first, it was very difficult to start her business, but thanks to her efforts, she was able to go on improving her life.

She is asking for this loan to invest it in the purchase of clothing and jewelry. In this way, she can continue with her sales and have the income to help her family.

loans.use: to buy clothes and jewelry to sell.

loans.name: Modesto

texts.en: Modesto is 59 years of age and works as a driver. He has been in this kind of business for 13 years. His need to maintain the good condition of his multicab, which he is using in his transportation business, encouraged him to seek the financial assistance of Kiva lenders. He is now asking for a loan of PHP 30,000 to be used to overhaul his multicab. He hopes that they will grant his loan request in order for him to generate sufficient income for his family.

loans.use: to overhaul his multicab.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: Joy is a 25-year-old woman who lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. To make a living, she owns and manages a farm planting and harvesting bananas for sale. She has been in this business for four years and her income is not enough to generate additional capital. Therefore, she borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase fertilizer such as manure. She hopes to have a bountiful harvest in order to generate more income for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 46 years old and married with five children.

Gemma works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

Gemma has borrowed and repaid eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and also earns an income from embroidery.

Gemma aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Jamal

texts.en: Jamal was born in 1986. He is single and has 2 brothers. He owns a herbs-selling store. Jamal is now requesting a youth loan to be able to expand his own store and add new types of herbs and natural medicines to earn better income from it.

loans.use: to add new types of herbs and natural medicine to his store.

loans.name: Yousra

texts.en:
Yousra is a 32-year-old, single woman. She has had a convenience store for the past 15 years, in order to make her living. Yousra is well-known in her region, with her special reputation and the hard work she does to improve her living.

She is applying for her third loan from Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua. She will use the loan to increase her business merchandise, with special summer sweets and beverages. She is planning to add special summer ice creams and smoothies that will bring joy to her village's citizens, especially children, and increase her income. Her previous loans helped her a lot in developing her business and in improving her living.

Yousra is a borrower in good standing, too. She is planning on developing and expanding her business, by moving to a wider store front and by diversifying her products, to respond to almost all of her customers' needs.

loans.use: To increase her business merchandise, adding special summer sweets and beverages

loans.name: Lowela

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Lowela works hard to support her family. She has a cafeteria business in the Philippines, and she earns additional income by selling fish.

Lowela is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy additional cups, sugar and other ingredients, for use at her coffee shop.

Lowela has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dreams -- to save enough money so she could continue to send her children to college, and could expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional cups, sugar and other ingredients, for her coffee shop.

loans.name: Mirjana

texts.en:
Mirjana is a 31-year-old mother of two young children. She lives in a minority community. Mirjana works in a prison as a guard, and her husband works for the electric company. They have tried to save money, but even so they could not manage to renovate their house, because they always had something to do that they needed money for, in their daily life. 

Now Mirjana is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy materials for renovating the house and to pay the workers. This loan will help her to improve the living conditions for her family, and to offer a better life to her children.  She hopes to offer a better education to her children, in the future. She wants to thank all Kiva lenders for their support!

loans.use: To renovate her family's house

loans.name: Sagrada Familia Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Sagrada Familia está en su ciclo número  2 del programa de comité de mujeres, es de la ciudad de Caaguazú, las integrantes están trabajando por crecer y dar a su familia lo que necesitan para el día a día. Ellas vieron una gran oportunidad de progreso en el comité es por eso que decidieron unirse.
La Sra. Liz es una de las integrantes, ella tiene una cantina en la escuela del barrio y cuenta que tiene todo tipo de productos, y con ello da a los alumnos de la escuela todo lo que piden. Desde muy tempranas horas del día empieza su trabajo, además de eso cuenta que su cantina es su fuente de ingresos y la forma en la que ayuda a su familia.
Solicita su crédito para la compra de golosinas, panchos, panes y la materia prima para la elaboración de comestibles para su venta en la cantina. Y de esa forma poder seguir creciendo con su negocio y dar así a su familia lo que necesitan para tener una vida sin privaciones.
texts.en:
The group known as "Sagrada Familia" is in its second cycle with the Women's Committee program. The group is in the city of Caaguazú, and its members are working to grow and to give their families what they need day to day. They saw a great opportunity for progress through the committee and that is why they decided to come together.

Liz, one of the members, has a cantina at the neighborhood school. She says that she carries many types of products so that she can sell the students anything they want. She starts working very early in the morning, and says that her cantina is her source of income and the way that she helps her family. 

She asks for a loan to buy snacks, hot dogs, breads and ingredients to make food for sale at the cantina. This way she will be able to keep growing her business and give her family what they need to live without lacking anything.

loans.use: to buy snacks, hot dogs, bread and other ingredients to make food for sale.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
La Sra. Julia es de la ciudad de Luque, está casada con el Sr. Pantaleón tienen tres hijos todos mayores edad por quienes toda la vida lucharon y se esforzaron. La Sra. Julia tiene un copetín desde el año 2009 en el cual trabaja y se está haciendo de muy buena clientela.
Ella es una persona muy trabajadora que quiere seguir creciendo para poder tener mejores ingresos y día a día mejorar su vida y la de su familia. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá para la compra de insumos para su copetín, como ser bebidas, golosinas, etc. y obtener de esa manera mayor variedad de productos para ofrecer a sus clientes. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe, pues le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Julia is from the city of Luque. She is married to Mr. Pantaleon and has 3 children, all of whom are grown, and for whom she and her husband have fought and worked hard all of their lives. Julia has had a fast food restaurant since 2009 where she works and has created a good clientele. 

She is a hardworking person who always wants to keep growing so that she can have more income and improve day-to-day life for herself and her family. She has requested a loan to invest in the purchase of ingredients for her restaurant like drinks, snacks, etc, so that she can offer a greater variety of products to her customers. She is thankful for this opportunity, as it wil be of great help to her.

loans.use: to buy drinks, snacks, etc.

loans.name: Barsilisa

texts.es:
Barsilisa es una Sra. joven, Está casada con el sr. Daniel viven en Ciudad del Este y no tienen hijos.
Ella tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de ropas en su casa, además por las mañana trabaja en una institución publica para aumentar sus ingresos. Ella compra las ropas de Argentina y del Brasil viajando semanalmente ya que las prendas de esos lugares son muy buenas.
Ella se inicio con  un dinero que junto con otros trabajos anteriores, mes a mes va aumentando su negocio con el salario que recibe en el otro trabajo y así ella por medio de su esfuerzo y con la ayuda de su marido va creciendo.
Ella es una persona muy responsable y con ganas de superación, tiene un espíritu jovial y emprendedor que no cabe duda que va a llegar a conseguir todas las metas que se ha propuesto.
Solicita de este crédito para invertirlo en la compra de prendas variadas, para que de esa forma pueda seguir con sus ventas y tener los ingresos que necesita.
texts.en:
Barsilisa is a young woman, married to Daniel and living in Ciudad del Este. They do not have any children. She has a small store selling clothing in her home, and she also works at a public institution in the mornings to augment her income. She will buy the clothing in Argentina and Brasil, traveling weekly since the clothing there is very good.

She started with money that she put together from previous jobs, and month by month she increases her business with the income that she receives from her other work. Through her hard work and help from her husband the business is growing. 

She is responsible and wants to get ahead; she has a jovial and entrepreneurial spirit and doesn't doubt that she will achieve all of the goals she has set for herself. 

She asks for this loan to buy garments so that she can continue her sales and make the income that she needs.

loans.use: to buy garments for sale.

loans.name: Sheikha Group

texts.en: This group is called Sheikha, and it is comprised of three women. They have applied for a loan of 150,000 YER from AMB, in order to address their immediate financial problems. Mriam is the leader of this group. A native of Taiz, Yemen, she is a 61-year-old, married woman who has six children, most of them attending school. She has a small house that she intends to build two rooms. She does not have more money to do that so she has requested this loan in order to buy  sand, cement, and iron to complete building her two rooms. She hopes to live with her family in a comfortable life.

loans.use: to buy building materials, such as sand, cement, and iron.

loans.name: Ramleh

texts.en:
Ramleh is from Iraq. She is 49 years old and has five children. Ever since Ramleh's husband passed away, Ramleh started providing her family's income with the aid of one of her children.

Ramleh works from her house and sews women’s and children’s outfits. When she was a child, Ramleh used to help her mother in sewing clothes and gained much experience since then. In 2010, she started sewing for a living. Ramleh became well known in the area, thanks to her competitive prices.

Ramleh is requesting a loan of $1,800 to buy two new sewing machines and a motor generator. She is aiming to grow in this field and increase her profits, so she will be able to educate her children and provide for her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy two new sewing machines and a motor generator.

loans.name: Noupagagnon 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les 6 membres du groupe   NOUPAGAGNON 1 sont des hommes mariés  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 42 ans, 7 enfants et vivant tous dans des  familles traditionnelles à  Kokouna, un des villages de SIKASSO, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Ils collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Ils sont à leur quatrième prêt avec l’institution et les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  le maïs avec Amadou en troisième position de la gauche vers la droite, il compte acheter avec son prêt, des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  3 hectares. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché de SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Il compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 500.000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi aider la grande famille dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The six members of the NOUPAGAGNON 1 group are married men who, on average, are 42 years old and have seven children each. They all live in traditional families in Kokouna, one of the villages of the Sikasso region, third administrative region of Mali.

They have joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to successfully carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are on their fourth loan with the institution and their previous loans have been duly repaid.

The featured borrower, Amadou, grows maize. In the photo, he is the third man from the left (in the standing row).  He plans to use his loan to buy agricultural inputs and seeds, and to pay for the cost of plowing to cultivate 3 hectares (7.41 acres) of land.

After the harvest, he sells his crop in the village and at the Sikasso market. His customers are both men and women.

Amadou is expecting to make an average profit of 500,000 CFA francs per season. This profit will allow him to repay his loan and to contribute to his large family's daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs and seeds, and to pay for the cost of plowing.

loans.name: Etidal

texts.en: Etidal is 42 years old. She lives in Salt, Jordan. She is married and has 4 children. Her husband has 2 jobs. She lives in a rented house. Following her previous handcraft business, she has started to sell shoes and clothes. Now she seeks a loan to expand her project by opening a shoes and clothes store to bring more customers from inside and outside her district.

loans.use: to expand her project by opening a shoes and clothes store to bring more customers from inside and outside her district.

loans.name: Tohoue-Bokossa Group

texts.fr: TOHOUE-BOKOSSA est un groupe composé de trois personnes qui sont des cohabitantes. La représentante du groupe du nom de Bernadette ( celle dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 64 ans. Bernadette est veuve, avec trois enfants dont certains scolarisés et un à sa charge. Bernadette vit avec ses enfants. Bernadette assure seule les charges de la maison. Bernadette n'a pas fréquenté l’école. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges Bernadette vend des boules d'akassa( pâte fait à base de maïs)à son domicile depuis dix ans. Bernadette s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle de plus en plus nombreuses et de se faire plus de profit, Bernadette sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe TOHOUE-BOKOSSA, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
TOHOUE-BOKOSSA is a group which consists of three women who live in the same house.  The group's representative, named Bernadette (and raising her hand in the photo) is 64 years old.  She is a widow and she has three children, some of whom are in school and one under her care.  Bernadette lives with her children and covers the household expenses alone.

Bernadette did not attend school. In order to meet her various expenses, she has been selling Akassa balls (a pasta prepared from maize) from her home for ten years.  She buys her supplies at a market located in Benin.

In order to better meet the demand from an increasing number of customers, and also to increase her profits, Bernadette is requesting a first loan from ALIDé, along with the other members of the TOHOUE-BOKOSSA group.

loans.use: to buy bags of maize.

loans.name: Jiguiseme Vii Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe    JIGUISEME VII sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 41 ans, 6 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à Kafana, un des villages de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du Mali.          
Elles collaborent  avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage.  
Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés. La spéculation cultivée est l’arachide avec  SALIMATA          debout au milieu. Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter les semences et les engrais  pour entretenir 1 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché de SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 60.000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The JIGUISEME VII group consists of married women who, on average, are 41 years old and have six children each. They all live in polygamous families in Kafana, one of the villages of the Cercle of Sikasso, third administrative region of Mali.

The members of the group have joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to successfully carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are on their fifth loan with the institution and their previous loans have been duly repaid.

The featured borrower, Salimata, grows groundnuts. In the photo, she is in the middle of the standing row. She plans to use her loan to buy seeds and fertilizers, in order to cultivate 1 hectare (2.47 acres) of land.

After the harvest, she sells her crop to both men and women, in her village and at the Sikasso market. 

She is expecting to make an average profit of 60,000 CFA francs per season. This profit will allow her to repay her loan and to help her husband cover the daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs and seeds.

loans.name: Tchia-Kpe Group

texts.fr: TCHIA-KPE est un groupe composé de trois personnes qui sont des cohabitantes. La représentante du groupe du nom de Ablawa Nicole ( celle dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 65 ans. Ablawa Nicole n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Ablawa Nicole est mariée à un certain Étienne. Le couple a deux enfants, dont un scolarisé et à leur charge. Ablawa Nicole vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Ablawa Nicole et son mari assurent ensemble les charges de ménage. Pour ce faire, Ablawa Nicole vend des produits divers (pâte alimentaire, huile, sucre, biscuit, etc.) à son domicile depuis une dizaine d’années. Ablawa Nicole s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle de plus en plus nombreuses et de se faire plus de profit, Ablawa Nicole sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe TCHIA-KPE, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en: TCHIA-KPE is a group of three people who are neighbours. The leader of the group named Ablawa Nicole (the one with her hand raised in the photo) is 65 years old. Ablawa Nicole did not go to school. Ablawa Nicole is married to a man named Etienne. The couple has two children of which one is studying at their expense. Ablawa Nicole lives with her husband and her children. She shares the family expenses with her husband. To enable her to do this Ablawa Nicole has been selling various products (pasta, oil, sugar, biscuits) from her home for about ten years. She buys her products at a market in Benin. In order to better satisfy her growing clientele, and make more profit, Ablawa Nicole, together with the other members of the TCHIA-KPE group, requests a first loan from Alidé.

loans.use: To buy various products (pasta, oil, sugar, biscuits, etc.)

loans.name: Benkadi 4 Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe Benkadi 4 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  30 ans et 2 enfants et vivant toutes dans des familles traditionnelles à NIANTANSO, un des villages de la 3ème région administrative du Mali (SIKASSO).
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur septième prêt de campagne agricole avec l’institution et tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autre: l’arachide, le riz et le pois sucré avec  KOROTOUMOU deuxième personne à droite de la photo position assise. Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants et  payer les frais de labours  pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 60.000FCFA en fin de campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Benkadi 4 group are married woman who, on average, are 30 years old and have two children. They all live in traditional families in Niantanaso, a village in the third administrative region of Mali (Sikasso). They are working with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to carry out their farming during the rainy season. They are on their seventh farm loan with the institution and all of their previous loans have been repaid.

Korotoumou, the second person seated on the right in the photo, grows, among other things, ground nuts, rice, and sweet peas. With her loan, she plans to buy farm inputs and to pay the cost of labor to maintain one hectare of land. 

After the harvest, she sells her crops in the village to men and women customers.

She hopes to earn an average of 60,000 francs CFA per crop harvest. These earnings will allow her to help her husband in the everyday expenses.

loans.use: to pay for labor and to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Noupagagnon  A Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe NOUPAGAGNON A sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  50 ans et 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des familles traditionnelles à KOLOKOBA, un des villages de la 3ème région administrative du Mali (SIKASSO).
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur septième prêt de campagne agricole avec l’institution et tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autre l’arachide, le riz, le mais et le piment  avec  FLAMOUSSO 1ère personne à gauche de la photo position assise, Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants et  payer les frais de labours  pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 90.000FCFA en fin de campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Noupagagnon A group are married women who, on average, are 50 years old and have three children. All live in traditional families in Kolokoba, a village in the third administrative region of Mali (Sikasso). They are working with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to carry out their farming during the rainy season. They are on their seventh farm loan with the institution, and all of their previous loans have been repaid correctly.

Flamousso, the first person seated on the left in the photo, grows, among other things, ground nuts, rice, corn, and peppers. With her loan, she plans to buy farm inputs and to pay the cost of labor to maintain one hectare of land.

After the harvest, she will sell her crops in the village to men and women customers. 

She hopes to earn an average 90,000 francs CFA per harvest. These earnings will allow her to help her husband in the everyday expenses.

loans.use: to pay the cost of labor and to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Muhammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 29-year-old married man from Qalqilia. He is a father with one son and one daughter. He is a very good worker in home electric repair. This is the only source of income for the family. Mohammad would like to improve the living conditions in his home by buying new furniture. 

Mohammad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy new furniture for the living room and bedroom. Mohammad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy new home furniture.

loans.name: Fausta

texts.en: Fausta  is a single mother of five children and none of her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (grandchildren). She has a business selling used clothes. She has applied for a loan of 1,200,000 Uganda shillings to buy more bales of used clothes. She generates additional income through tailoring. She has been in this clothing business for 10 years. She works in the market seven days a week and sells on a retail basis only.  Her major business challenges include seasonality and the ever increasing prices of used clothes. She aspires to become a wholesaler and also to get another piece of land so as to practice farming. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en: Hoa was born in 1950. She has a daughter and a son. Her daughter has gotten married. Her son is learning at the University of Information Technology. Her husband is a guard to earn a living. His income is about 4,000,000 VND per month. Hoa sells groceries and earns about 5,000,000 VND per month. She has done this job for five years. Besides that, she also is a farmer. Her family’s total income is about 9,000,000 VND per month. Her challenge in work is a lack of capital to expand her grocery store and pay for her children’s education. She is a hardworking woman. She has participated in SEDA’s credit program since 2011. In the last loan cycle, she borrowed 6,758,000 VND. In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 8,066,000 VND to buy beer, beverages, biscuits and noodles for her grocery store.

loans.use: to buy beer, beverages, biscuits and noodles for her grocery store.

loans.name: Consolee

texts.en: Consolee is 31 years old. She has been selling rice, cooking oil and maize flour for four months. With the loan, she would like to add more volume of rice and maize flour to sell. The profits from the business will be used to make more reinvestments.

loans.use: To buy more rice and maize flour to sell.

loans.name: Anitha

texts.en: Anitha is 42 years old. She has been selling minerals for four years. She wants the loan to invest in the business of minerals by buying land where to mine those valuable stones. She will use the profits from the business to increase her savings.

loans.use: To buy land for mining mineral resources for sale.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 30-year-old Aminata from Tombo Western rural area. She is married with one child aged 2 years. She has two relative whose school fees she also takes care of.

Aminata runs an Entertainment centre business: she sells coffee, tea, bread and soft drinks within her community. She has been running this business since 2007. She works at the business 10 hours a day, 7 days a week. Aminata says that the main challenge to her business is insufficient capital for expansion.

Aminata has requested a loan in order to purchase more soft drinks, coffee and tea for resale. The extra income from this loan will allow her to start a savings account and increase her business. In the future, she plans to open a nightclub center. She thanks you for your support

loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks, coffee and tea to resell.

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Marie is 42 years old and married with three children between the ages of 15 and 5 years. She runs a clothing business in the Jui eastern area in Freetown. She started business because she wants to improve her standard of living. 

She's been in this business for four years and sells different type of cloth within the community.  She describes her major hardship as inadequate funds to run her business, and transportation problems.  

Marie requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase waxed cotton to expand her business. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and repay her loan. 

In the future, she would like to expand her business. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase waxed cotton to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more cooking ingredients to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to construct a greenhouse

loans.name: Agness Honorine

texts.fr: Agness est  une jeune femme de 37 ans mariée mère de 6 enfants dont l'age varie entre 3 et 17 ans. Après sa formation, elle a ouvert un petit atelier de couture qui fonctionne bien depuis 2 ans déjà, elle fait aussi la broderie mais n'a pas tout le matériel pour aller plus vite avec ses commandes et pouvoir satisfaire sa clientèle à temps. C'est pour celà qu'elle sollicite un crédit pour s'acheter des tissus et le petit matériel de coutures (épingles, aiguilles, doublure, fil...) qui l'évitera d'aller au marché tout le temps, elle pourra coudre et revendre à ses clients. Le bénéfice tiré de ce crédit lui permettra non seulement de s'acheter son petit matériel de couture pour agrandir son activité, mais aussi de satisfaire certains de ses besoins ainsi que ceux de sa famille.
texts.en: Agness is a young 37-year-old woman who is married and the mother of 6 children aged between 3 and 17. After her training, she opened a small sewing workshop which has been working well for 2 years already. She also embroiders but does not have the material she needs to be able to get through her orders more quickly and satisfy her customers in a timely manner. This is why she is requesting a loan with which to buy fabric and sewing accessories (pins, needles, lining, thread, etc.) which will enable her to avoid going to the market all the time and she will be able to sew and sell to her customers. The profits generated thanks to this loan will allow her to buy her sewing equipment and expand her business, and also to fulfill some of her needs as well as those of her family.

loans.use: to buy fabric and sewing accessories.

loans.name: Benoit

texts.fr: Benoit est un homme de 37 ans marié et père 3 enfants dont l'age varie entre 4 et 10 ans. il est commerçant dans un marché de la place depuis 13 ans où il vend la chaussures pour enfants, hommes et des dames (en fonction des saisons et des ballots). à cause de la petitesse de son capital, il est obligé d’aller au déballage chaque week-end pour acheter en détail des chaussures qu'il expose dans son comptoir. Cela ne rapporte pas vraiment d'où l'importance de crédit pour son activité parce qu'il lui permettra d'acheter un ballot mixte. il économisera le bénéfice que lui apportera ce crédit pour ouvrir une boutique de chaussures.
texts.en: Benoit is a 37-year-old man who is married and the father of 3 children aged between 4 and 10. He has been selling shoes for children, men and women (depending on the seasons and the contents of the bundles) at a local market for 13 years. Due to the small size of his capital, he is forced to go to the unpacking each weekend to buy shoes in retail amounts, which he then displays on his stall. This does not allow him to earn much, hence the importance of this loan for his business because it will allow him to buy a mixed bundle of shoes. He will save the profits generated thanks to this loan to open a shoe shop.

loans.use: to increase his inventory of shoes.

loans.name: Priscilla

texts.en:
Priscilla is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

Priscilla has operated a fresh water supply business for the past ten years, operating from home for neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of water rationing in her business. 

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to start a firewood sales business and purchase firewood for resale. She dreams of expanding her business to earn more income in the future.

loans.use: to start a firewood sales business and to purchase firewood for resale.

loans.name: Billah

texts.en:
Billah is a married woman with four children, who still attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past ten years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour and sugar. She faces a major challenge of debtors staying long to pay their debts. 

With the loan Billah is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Anastasie

texts.fr: anastasie est une femme de 47 ans mariée mère de 05 enfants dont l'age varie entre 19 et 31 ans. Elle a aussi trois de ses petits fils qui sont à sa charge et 3 de ses enfants vont encore à l'école. Elle a pour activité la vente des vivres (arachides, piment,oignons, gombo)depuis 3 ans déjà. elle n'a pas un gros capital, ce qui l'oblige à acheter ses marchandises en petites quantités, attendre de tous vendre pour pouvoir s'en procurer d'autres. d'où la rupture permanente des stocks et l'insatisfaction de sa petites clientèle qu'elle a acquise. en augmentant son capital, elle pourra non seulement augmenter son stock de marchandises satisfaire sa clientèle en évitant les ruptures de stocks, vendre plus et donc augmenter ses bénéfices. Elle réinvestira une partie de ces bénéfices dans l'activité et économisera l'autre pour les rentrées scolaires de leurs enfants.
texts.en: Anastasie is a 47-year-old woman who is married and the mother of 5 children aged between 19 and 31. She is also raising 3 of her grandsons and 3 of her children attend school. She has been selling food (peanuts, peppers, onions, okra) for 3 years already. She does not have a large amount of capital, which forces her to buy her merchandise in small quantities and to wait until she's sold everything before she can buy more. Therefore, she is constantly facing stock shortages and the dissatisfaction of her small customer base. By raising her capital, she will be able to increase her inventory and satisfy her clientèle by avoiding stock shortages, sell more and therefore increase her profits. She will reinvest part of these profits in her business and save the rest for when her children go back to school.

loans.use: to increase her inventory of food.

loans.name: Mwero

texts.en:
Mwero is a married man with seven children, all of whom attend school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

He has operated a retail shop business for the past twenty years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. He faces a major challenge of theft in his business. 

With the loan he is requesting, he wants to purchase additional stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. He decided to join Yehu to access loans in order to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William lives in Mombasa Kenya. For the last three years, he has been buying and selling glass. He has one employee who helps him in running the business. He learned about Milango through a friend, and now he seeks a loan of 21,100 Kenya shillings to buy louver glass. 

In five years he expects to have a wholesale supply shop. The major challenge he faces is the competition. The extra income that will come from the loan will improve his living standards.

loans.use: to buy louver glass

loans.name: Edgar Sr.

texts.en: Edgar Sr. is married and has three children. He lives in Gata Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He owns and operates a service-based business providing transportation services in the community. He has been doing this for a year and has recently requested a loan from GDMPC micro credit to repair an existing motor. He plans to purchase another unit of motor for expansion of the business.

loans.use: to repair an existing motor

loans.name: Bernagen

texts.en: This time, Bernagen is applying for a new loan of PHP 43,000 to buy raw materials for her guitar-making business.  Her business was previously funded through NWTF and KIVA to continue operations and provide Bernagen and her family with income that is improving their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to make guitars

loans.name: Ediltrudes

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Ediltrudes works hard to support her family.

She has a shell crafting business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from her general store.  Ediltrudes is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF in order to buy materials needed for her shell craft business.

Ediltrudes has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her shell craft business.

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en: Zahida is a 36-year-old married woman and mother of three children. Zahida is shown in the photo with her husband who is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it functional. For this reason, Zahida applied for a loan of 20,000 PKR for her husband. He wants to buy new tires for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. Zahida is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires for her husband's vehicle.

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en: Hoa was born in 1971. She has two children who are learning at the university and the 11th grade. Her husband grows landscape trees to earn a living. He earns about 4,000,000 VND per month. Hoa sells fruits in a market and helps her husband grow trees. She has done this job for seven years. She earns about 4,000,000 VND per month. Her family’s total income is about 8,000,000 VND per month. Her challenge in work is the lack of capital. Her dream is to raise her children well and invest in growing landscape trees. This loan is one of the steps to help her reach her dream. She is a passionate businesswoman. She has participated in SEDA’s credit program since 2013. In this first loan cycle, she wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to buy more fruits to sell and to plant landscape trees.

loans.use: to buy more fruits to sell and to plant landscape trees.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Juliet is 32 years old, married and the mother of two kids. She lives in Calabayan, Ozamis City, where she has earned a living for the last two years by selling home and used products. Aside from doing this, she also manages her piggery raising piglets for sale. She borrowed 5,000 PHP from GDMPC micro credit to purchase feed and piglets to raise. She plans to expand her piggery to generate additional income for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase feed and piglets to raise

loans.name: Marie Th.'s Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe existe depuis la création du bv le 23 Mars 1995. Il est composé de membres qui habitent le même village et exerçant la même activité qu'est l'embouche bovine et ovine. 

Debout à droite de la photo et levant la main, la représentante Marie, est âgée de 37 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 07 enfants dont 03 garçons et 04 filles. 

Avec le prêt reçu, elle achète 02 bœufs à 150 000 frs l'unité et également 05 moutons à 40 000 frs l'unité, l'alimentation et le vaccin lui reviennent à 60 000 frs.  Après 06 mois d'entretien, elle revend les bœufs à 200 000 l'unité et un mouton à 75 000 frs. 

Les bénéfices reçus lui permettent d'améliorer son habitat ( maison qui est en chantier)afin d'améliorer le niveau de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
This group exists since the creation of the "banc villageois" on the 23rd of March, 1995. It is made up of members who live in the same village and all practise cattle and sheep fattening.

The group's representative, Marie, is standing on the far right of the picture and raising her hand. She is 37 years old, married and the mother of 7 children, 3 of whom are boys and 4, girls. With the loan she receives she will buy 2 heads of cattle (at 150 000 francs per head) and 5 sheep (at 40 000 francs per head) as well as feed and vaccinations, which will cost 60 000 francs. After raising them for 6 months, she will resell the cattle for 200 000 francs per head and the sheep for 75 000 francs per head. The profits she makes will enable her to improve her home (her house is currently under construction) and improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy cattle and sheep for raising and, later, resale.

loans.name: Therese  B.'s Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe existe depuis la création du bv le 23 Mars 1995. Les membres qui le composent sont très proches car le lien de parenté existant. 

Debout à droite de la photo et levant la main, la vedette Suzanne est de 53 ans. Elle est veuve et mère de 07 enfants dont 03 garçons. 

Avec le prêt reçu, elle va acheter du tissu pour une valeur de 200 000 frs, une tonne de riz à 250 000 frs et un mouton à 50 000 frs pour revendre à 225 000 pour le tissu, 257500 frs pour le riz et 75 000 frs le mouton (après 06 mois pour ce dernier). 

Les bénéfices générés par l'activité lui permettent de renforcer ses épargnes pour une partie et l'autre assurer les besoins familiaux de sa famille en santé et nourriture.
texts.en: This group exists since the creation of the "banc villageois" on the 23rd of March, 1995. It is made up of members who are very close because of family relationships. The featured member, Suzanne, is standing on the far right of the picture and raising her hand. She is 53 years old, widowed and the mother of 7 children, 3 of whom are boys. With the loan she receives, she will buy 200 000 francs worth of fabric, a ton of rice for 250 000 francs and a sheep for 50 000 francs, so that she can resell the fabric for for 225 000 francs, the rice for 257 500 francs and the sheep for 75 000 francs, after raising it for 6 months. The profits generated by her business will enable her to build her savings and take care of her family's healthcare and food needs.

loans.use: to buy  fabric, a sheep and rice for resale.

loans.name: Melchora

texts.es:
Melchora cuenta que trabaja todos los dias desde muy tempranas horas en su despensa y carnicería, que por medio de su negocio esta saliendo adelante, y ayuda a su familia. Ella es una persona muy emprendedora, que con mucho sacrificio y trabajo esta saliendo adelante.
Ella comenta que con su crédito anterior de Kiva ha podido surtir con mas variedad de productos su negocio y así ofrecer mas insumos a ellos. Hoy vuelve a pedir del crédito para invertirlo en la compra de vegetales, carnes, bebidas, productos a granel, y de esa forma seguir creciendo y mejorando su economía. Agradece por la gran oportunidad que esta recibiendo.
texts.en:
Melchora says that she works every day starting very early in her store and butcher shop. With this business, she is getting ahead and helping her family. She is a very enterprising woman, who with a lot of hard work and sacrifice is getting ahead. 

She says that with the previous Kiva loan she was able to stock a wider variety of products and offer her customers more things. Today she is back to ask for the loan to invest in buying vegetables, meats, beverages, and bulk products. This way, she can keep growing and improving her finances. She is grateful for this great opportunity that she is getting.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meats, beverages, and bulk products.

loans.name: Mareme's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 10 femmes fait parti du Banc Villageois qui a été crée le 06/07/2006. Ce dernier est composé par des femmes qui habitent le même village et des villages environnants. Elles pratiquent pour la plupart comme activité le commerce.
Khady,  mariée et mère de 2 garçons, est âgée de 35 ans. Sur la photo elle est en position debout et a levé la main. Elle fait comme activité l’embouche, elle travaille avec son mari.
