Desea en esta ocasión contar con 2,000 nuevos soles para contratar a trabajadores del lugar.
texts.en:
Mariza, 33, lives with her partner and their two children in an adobe house they bought together.  She has been involved in agriculture for 14 years and owns six acres of farmland where she grows cocoa, coffee, peanuts and other products.

She enjoys her work because she learned the trade from her parent,s and also because likes to care for her crops.  She uses organic fertilizer in order to grow the best products possible.  She always hires local workers who help clear the weeds around the cocoa trees to protect new sprout growth.  The main inconvenience she faces is having to transport the sacks of dry beans to the city where the collectors are located, and they are the ones who pay the best price.  Since she has a considerably large cropland she always must hire workers to help.

She is requesting a loan of 2,000 PEN to hire local workers.

loans.use: To hire local workers.

loans.name: Roxana

texts.es: La Sra. Roxana tiene 50 años, tiene un hijo de la edad de 21 años que se encuentra estudiando en la universidad ella se dedica a la venta de pollo al espiedo en su pensión se encuentra en un de las calles concurridas de la zona de Kiswaras,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, La Sra. Roxana va a usar este préstamo para compra de espiadera para  la elaboración de sus pollo al espiedo, su razón para solicitar este préstamo la falta de efectivo para la compra esta herramienta útil para su negocio,  La Sra. Roxana enfrenta retos en su negocio que son las condiciones climáticas y también la competencia  de los demás negocios de comida rapida por lo mismo que tiene que tratar de reducir sus costos y mejorar su sazón   de sus platillos, y va a utilizar los beneficios en la compra de utensilios  y también en la ampliación de la misma para poder captar más clientes, La Sra. Roxana es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por esta oportunidad brindada en la otorgación del crédito.
texts.en:
Roxana is 50 years old.  She has one child, 21 years old, who is studying at university.  She makes a living selling rotisserie chicken from her home located on one of the busy streets of the Kiswaras area.  

This loan is her first sequence within the institution.  Roxana is going to use this loan to purchase a rotisserie oven in order to make her rotisserie chicken.  Her reason for requesting this loan is the lack of cash to purchase this useful tool for her business.  

Roxana faces challenges in her business such as climate conditions and also competition from other fast-food businesses which is why she has to try to reduce her costs and improve the flavor of her dishes.  She is going to use the profit on the purchase of utensils and also on the expansion of the business in order to be able to attract more customers.  

Roxana is a very hardworking person who feels happy for this opportunity offered through the loan.

loans.use: to buy a rotisserie oven.

loans.name: Julio

texts.es: El socio Julio nació en la ciudad de Pilco – Grande y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació, él tiene 50 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un hijo, él se dedica a la agricultura, a la ganadería y también a la venta de madera, él requiere el préstamo para comprar más madera, él está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de sus cuotas. (La comunidad de Pilco – Grande está ubicado en el distrito de Huayllabamba dentro de la provincia de Paucartambo en el  departamento de Cusco, Perú).
texts.en:
Julio was born in the city of Pilco- Grande where he still lives.  He is 50 years old and has a common-law wife and a son.  He works in agriculture and livestock farming, and also sells wood.  He is in need of a loan to buy more wood.  He is grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

(The Pilco - Grande Community is located in the district of Huayllabamba in the province of Paucartambo, department of Cusco, Perú).

loans.use: To buy more wood.

loans.name: Los Famosos De Chocaman Group

texts.es:
El señor Alejandro es casado, tiene 51 años de edad, curso 4 años de educacion primaria, tiene 6 hijos y no estan estudiando, él se dedica al comercio, inició este negocio por iniciativa propia contando con un pequeño capital y hasta la fecha tiene 10 años de experiencia. Cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa quien también es comerciante.

Organiza un grupo y solicita un préstamo que le servirá para la compra de mercadería para tener surtida su venta tales como: pantalones para caballero, sueteres y camisas. En el futuro desea tener una tienda en un lugar bien establecido, los demás integrantes del grupo se dedican al comercio. En la foto aparecen 6 personas pero 1 de ellos no calificó para el préstamo.
texts.en:
Alejandro is married, is 51 years old, with four years of primary education.  He has six children and they are not studying. He is engaged in commerce. He started this business on his own initiative, having little capital, and to date, he has ten years of experience. He has the support of his wife, who is also a businesswoman.

He is organizing a group and applying for a loan that he will use to purchase merchandise to have his store stocked, such as: men's pants, sweaters and shirts. In the future, he hopes to have a store in a well-established location. 

The other members of the group are engaged in commerce.  There are six people in the photo, but one of them did not qualify for the loan.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock his store.

loans.name: Ingrids Patricia

texts.es:
Ingrids tiene 40 años de edad, esta casada y tiene tres hijos, una hembra de 15 años que estudia 8ª grado y dos  varones de 10 años que cursa el 3ª grado y 2 ½ años respectivamente. Viven en casa propia.

Ella aprendió a costurar en una academia, fue el oficio de su preferencia y lo aprendió recién se casó con el objetivo de apoyar económicamente a su esposo con los gastos de vida de la familia. Se dedica a la elaboración de uniformes escolares, trajes para empleadas de oficinas, vestidos de novias y quinceañeras, etc.

El esposo  aprendió a elaborar prendas de vestir para caballeros (pantalones y camisas) a los 14 años de edad con un tío que le enseño el oficio, pero dejo de hacerlo cuando tubo la oportunidad de un empleo, posteriormente por la mala situación de la empresa dejó de laborar y retomó su oficio por lo que es el encargado de confeccionar la ropa para caballeros.


El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar tres maquinas ranas y el resto será utilizado como capital de trabajo.


Necesitan contratar tres operarios con el objetivo de cumplir con la demanda; pues tomaron el compromiso de confeccionar 2298 piezas de uniformes de dos centros escolares. Esto lo cancela el ministerio de educación hasta que terminan y no dan adelanto de pago.


Su deseo es, ampliar su negocio de servicio de costura, alquilar un local grande para trabajar, considerando que poseen buena demanda.
texts.en:
Ingrids is 40 years old, married, and has three children, a 15 year old daughter who is in 8th grade and two sons, a 10 year old who is in 3rd grade and a 2 ½ year old.  They live in a house they own.

She learned how to sew at school.  It was her preferred trade and she learned when she was recently married so that she could help her husband with the household expenses.  She works making school uniforms, suits for office workers, and dresses for weddings and quinceañeras.  

Her husband learned to make men's clothing (pants and shirts) from an uncle at 14 years old, but he had to stop when he had the opportunity for a job.  Later, due to a bad situation at work, he stopped working and restarted his business making men's clothing.  

Ingrids is requesting this loan from Fundación Campo to purchase three overlock sewing machines and to use as working capital.  She needs to hire three workers to meet demand.  She has a contract to make 2298 uniforms for two schools.  The ministry of education will pay when she finishes and they do not advance payment.

Her dream is to expand her sewing business and rent a large space to work since she has high demand.

loans.use: to purchase three overlock sewing machines.

loans.name: Perla Maria

texts.es: Perla, es una joven de 23 años de edad, que estudia la carrera de Banca y Finanzas, recibe el apoyo de sus padres para continuar sus estudios ya que en la actualidad no está laborando aun, está por finalizar sus estudios, pero el costo del curso de titulación es muy alto por lo que está optando a solicitar crédito para poder cubrir este gasto que es muy importante para su desarrollo personal ya que con titulo en mano le será más fácil desplazarse en busca de trabajo y con sus ingresos ayudar a sus padres, quienes con tanto esfuerzo han logrado llevarla hasta el final.
texts.en:
Perla is a 23 year old young woman who is studying banking and finance.  She receives support from her parents in order to continue her studies.  She is still not working, and she is about to complete her studies.  

However, the cost of paying for licensing and registration requirements is very high.  That is why she is opting to request a loan in order to be able to cover this expense.  This is very important for her personal development.  With her credentials in hand, it will be much easier for her to move forward in looking for work.  Also, she will have income to help her parents, who with so much effort have managed to take her to the finish line.

loans.use: to pay for licensing and registration.

loans.name: Verline

texts.en:
Verline is 40 years old and married, with three children. With her three children currently in school, Verline works very hard to provide for them.

Verline runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase more items to sell in her general store, like noodles, snack foods, soft drinks, and canned goods.

Verline has been in this business for three years and she sells a variety of items, such as noodles, snack foods, soft drinks, and canned goods. 

In the future, Verline would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store, like noodles, snack foods, soft drinks, and canned goods.

loans.name: Nadzuwa

texts.en:
Nadzuwa is married and has nine children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has no electricity or piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past ten years, she has owned a cafe business, where neighbors and town dwellers are her customers. She faces a major challenge of fluctuations in the number of clients, hence perishable of goods expire, leading to losses.

With the Kshs 20,000, she wants to purchase stocks of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour, and cooking oil. She dreams of expanding to a modern café in the future.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Sabas

texts.es:
Sabas es una mujer humilde de 33 años de edad casada y de su matrimonio tiene 4 hijos de los cuales la hija mayor ya está casada y en hogar a parte las dos que le siguen a ella en el colegio y el menor en la escuela. Ella tiene un grado de educación primaria cursado hasta el cuarto grado y no pudo continuar por la falta de apoyo económico por parte de sus padres. Fueron ellos los que le enseñaron a trabajar la tierra desde muy pequeña en lo que es la caficultura. 

Hoy en día ella solicita ayuda para compra de insumos y dar mantenimiento a sus cultivos de café el cual se limpiara, se le aplicara foliares para evitar plagas, será fertilizado y abonado.  

Sus sueños son los de tecnificar su tierra donde tiene cultivado café, que mejore el rendimiento en cuanto a producción para que sea más llamativo para sus clientes y así podrá seguir generando ingresos para su familia y seguir apoyando a sus tres hijos los cuales aún están estudiando.
texts.en:
Sabas is a reserved person, 33 years old, married with four children and her eldest daughter is already married, and at home there are two more attending school and the youngest is in primary.

She has an elementary school education through the fourth grade and could not continue due to the lack of financial support from her parents. It was from them that she learned to work the land growing coffee from a very early age.

Today she is asking for help in order to buy supplies to maintain her coffee crops which are to be cleaned, to apply foliar to avoid infestations, and the crops will be fertilized.

Her dreams are to use technology on her land where she grows coffee, in order to improve the yield of production so she can make it more appealing to her customers and thus continue earning income for her family and continue supporting her three children who are still studying.

loans.use: to buy supplies so she can maintain her coffee crops

loans.name: Zenobia

texts.es: La socia Zenobia nació en la ciudad de Pilco – Grande y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació, ella tiene 32 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene seis hijos, ella se dedica a la agricultura, a la venta de frutas y también a la crianza de animales menores como por ejemplo cuyes, gallinas, chanchos y otros, ella requiere el préstamo para comprar animales menores como cuyes y gallinas, ella está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de sus cuotas. (La comunidad de Pilco – Grande está ubicado en el distrito de Huayllabamba dentro de la provincia de Paucartambo en el  departamento de Cusco, Perú).
texts.en: Zenobia was born in the city of Pilco Grande and lives in her city of birth. She is 32 years old and has a partner, with whom she has six children. She makes a living in agriculture, selling fruits and raising small animals such as guinea pigs, chickens, pigs and others.She needs the loan to buy mall animals such as guinea pigs and chickens. She is grateful for the loan and is committed to makes her loan repayments. The Community of Pilco Grande is located in the district of Huayllabamba in the province of Paucartambo in Cusco Department, Peru).

loans.use: to buy small animals such as guinea pigs and chickens.

loans.name: Jhaquilou

texts.en:
Jhaquilou is a married woman from the town of Bien Unido, Bohol. She runs a small 'sari-sari' or variety store business selling various goods and items to the people in her place. Her husband is a fisherman.

Jhaquilou is asking for a loan to buy stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, snack foods and materials for house repair like cement, wood, nails and others. With this, she will be able to improve her business as well as her shelter.

loans.use: to buy stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, snack foods and materials for house repair like cement, wood, nails and others

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is 60 years old and married, with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Remedios runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 19,500 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy more groceries to sell.

Remedios has been in this business for ten years and she sells a variety of items, such as sugar, soap and other groceries. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Manal

texts.en:
Manal is 33 years old and comes from Gaza. She is married and has seven children; five attend primary school. She has owned a grocery store since 2009.

She asked Ryada for this loan in order to buy a refrigerator, install shelves, and develop her grocery store. She hopes that this loan will help her increase the goods displayed and thus improve her family's income.

The one who appears in the picture is Manal's husband due to cultural manners.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator,  install shelves, and develop her grocery store.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is married with three children, and two of her children go to school. She has a business of selling used clothes and has been in this business for nine months. 

She has applied for a loan of 1,200,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bales of used clothes. She generates additional income through working a nurse and selling piped water. She works at the market five days out of every week and sells on a retail basis only.  

Her major business challenges include transport and defaulters. She is aspiring of importing used clothes and also to see her children go up to university level. She resides in her own house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and paying for utility bills.

loans.use: to buy more bales of used clothes and bed sheets

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is a married lady, 29-years-old, and is supporting three members of her family. Her children are between ages six and three years old. She offers M-PESA (mobile payment) services in the Kabarnet location and has been in operation for a period of four years, earning an income of KES. 20,000.

She is now servicing her third loan of KES. 70,000 from KADET LTD and intends to use this amount to increase her business float (inventory) to enable her serve her customers. The profits she earns will be used to purchase stock her cosmetics shop.  

Her dream is to start an M-PESA services business in another location and educate her children to greater levels.

loans.use: To increase her M-PESA (mobile payments) business float (inventory)

loans.name: Begimo

texts.ru: Бегимо замужем. Ей 52 года. У нее одна дочь в возрасте 10 лет, которая учится в средней школе. Бегимо живет и работает в районе Хамадони. Муж Бегимо работает в центральном рынке столицы. Он занимается торговлей детских одежд. У Бегимо среднее техническое образование. Она добрая и отзывчивая женщина. Бегимо по специальности портниха. Она вот уже 10 лет занимается этим видом деятельности. У нее богатый опыт в этой области. Бегимо вышивает женские национальные платья у себя на дому. Она хочет расширить бизнес и купить еще одну швейную машинку. С этой целью Бегимо обратилась за кредитом. Она надеется и ждет Вашей помощи.
texts.en: Begimo is married. She is 52 years old. She has one 10-year old daughter attending secondary school. Begimo lives and works in the Hamadoni district. Begimo’s husband works at the central market of the capital city. He sells children’s clothing. Begimo has finished technical college. She is a kind and compassionate woman. Begimo is a seamstress by trade. She has a rich experience in this area. Begimo sews traditional women’s dresses at home. She would like to expand her business and buy an additional sewing machine. With this goal, Begimo has applied to a loan. She hoping and waiting for your help.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine so as to expand her business.

loans.name: Sigei

texts.en:
Sigei lives in the Litein area of Kenya. He has six children and has been doing this work (farming) for five years.  His primary income sources are milk, eggs, and tea.

He stated what is most enjoyable about farming: 'Dairy farming'.  His biggest challenge is 'Insufficient funds.' Animals on the farm have been given the names of 'Bois.'

Sigei was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied: 'Because of their good grace period.'  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: 'It gives loans in groups.'

His highest monthly expense is family expenses. When asked 'How will this loan benefit your family?', Sigei replied 'Will earn more income.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Sigei owns the following: 'cow, poultry' but does not own 'pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, automobile'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household  'mosquito net' but does not have 'electricity, solar power, running water, sewing machine, TV, DVD'.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: to construct a zero grazing unit
